meanings.definition: To act as a subordinate or secondary agent.
meanings.sent1: She will subact as the assistant manager during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The team will subact according to the coach's instructions.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to subact as the dog's shadow for the day.
meanings.sent4: The moon subacts as a guiding light in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The student subacted diligently in the group project.

meanings.definition: To perform a subordinate or secondary action.
meanings.sent1: He needs to subact by following the main character's lead.
meanings.sent2: The robot will subact by completing the repetitive tasks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to subact as a tiny acrobat on the tree branches.
meanings.sent4: The wind subacts by gently caressing the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent5: The child subacted by mimicking the actions of the adults around.

meanings.definition: To carry out a secondary or supporting function.
meanings.sent1: The backup generator will subact in case of a power outage.
meanings.sent2: Each team member will subact to ensure the project's success.
meanings.sent3: The clown decided to subact as a silent performer for the day.
meanings.sent4: The river subacts by providing a source of life for the surrounding ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The sun subacts by providing warmth and light to the planet.
